sectiondef.header: Method for starting and ending a text

description.para: Once started, DrawText should be called for actually drawing the text.
Font can be changed between called for DrawText

sectiondef.header: Move a text to the specified position, for example when starting a new line.

description.para: These methods should be called only between a StartText and EndText call.
This can be used for example for not taking into account the bounding box of parts of the graphic.

One example is the connectors in lyrics. This is a non-virtual method and hence cannot be overridden. In only changes a flag. The effect of the flag has to be defined in the child class. It should not be called twice in a row. Is it also possible to deactivate only X or Y axis. Reactivate will reactivate both axis.

sectiondef.header: Method for starting and ending a graphic

description.para: For example, the method can be used for grouping shapes in <g></g> in SVG

memberdef.argsstring: (Object *object, std::string gClass, std::string gId, bool primary=true, bool preprend=false)=0
memberdef.name: StartGraphic

sectiondef.header: Method for starting and ending a graphic custom graphic that do not correspond to an Object

description.para: For example, the method can be used for grouping shapes in <g></g> in SVG

sectiondef.header: Methods for re-starting and ending a graphic for objects drawn in separate steps

description.para: The methods can be used to the output together, for example for a Beam

sectiondef.header: Method for starting and ending a text graphic when it needs to be different from a normal graphic.

description.para: For example, in SVG, a text graphic is a <tspan> (and not a <g>)
This should be called only once per graphic and before drawing anything in it.

sectiondef.header: Method for starting and ending page

briefdescription.para: flag for indicating if the graphic is deactivated

stores the width and height of the device context
stores the height of graphic content

Special method for forcing bounding boxes to be updated Used for invisible elements (e.g.

detaileddescription.para: <space>) that needs to be take into account in spacing

briefdescription.para: Method indicating if default global styling is used.

detaileddescription.para: Typically this is the case with SVG and CSS. When global styling is used, some elements will not set corresponding styles. Global styling is false by default.

briefdescription.para: This class is an abstract device context.

detaileddescription.para: It enables different types of concrete classes to be implemented. For example: MusWxDC - a wrapper to wxDCs with wxWidgets; SvgDeviceContext - a non-gui file DC; MusCairoDC - a wrapper to a Cairo surface; The class uses int-based colour encoding (instead of wxColour in wxDC). It uses FontInfo (instead of wxFont in wxDC).
